org.hbase.async

Class HBaseRpc

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hbase.async.HBaseRpc
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppendRequest, AtomicIncrementRequest, DeleteRequest, GetRequest, MultiColumnAtomicIncrementRequest, PutRequest, RowLockRequest

    public abstract class HBaseRpc
extends Object
    Abstract base class for all RPC requests going out to HBase.

    Implementations of this class are not expected to be synchronized.

    A note on passing byte arrays in argument

    None of the method that receive a byte[] in argument will copy it. If you change the contents of any byte array you give to an instance of this class, you may affect the behavior of the request in an unpredictable way. If you need to change the byte array, clone it before giving it to this class. For those familiar with the term "defensive copy", we don't do it in order to avoid unnecessary memory copies when you know you won't be changing (or event holding a reference to) the byte array, which is frequently the case.

      • isTraceRPC

      • setFailfast

        public final boolean setFailfast(boolean failfast)
        Set whether the RPC not be retried upon encountering a problem.

        RPCs can be retried for various legitimate reasons (e.g. NSRE due to a region moving), but under certain failure circumstances (such as a node going down) we want to give up and be alerted as soon as possible.

        Parameters:
        failfast - If true, this RPC should fail-fast as soon as we know we have a problem.
        Returns:
        whether the RPC not be retried upon encountering a problem.
        Since:
        1.5

      • failfast

        public final boolean failfast()
        Returns whether the RPC not be retried upon encountering a problem.
        Returns:
        whether the RPC not be retried upon encountering a problem.
        Since:
        1.5
        See Also:
        setFailfast(boolean)

      • isProbe

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        A timeout, in milliseconds, to set for this RPC. If the RPC cannot be sent and processed by HBase within this period then a RpcTimedOutException will be returned in the deferred.

        If no timeout is set, then "hbase.rpc.timeout" will be used by default. However if a value of "0" is supplied as the timeout, then the RPC will not be timed out.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is less than zero
        Since:
        1.7

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        An optional timeout for the RPC in milliseconds. Note that the initial value is -1, meaning the RPC will use the default value configured in hbase.rpc.timeout.
        Returns:
        The timeout value in milliseconds.
